Image description/alt text: Are you an American or and American't?
Excuse text: Voting is really complicated
Answer Text: Voter suppression and discouragement are real. Don't let it work on you.

Excuse text: I am overwhelmed with life right now
Answer Text: Feel Better?

Excuse text: I don't know who to vote for
Answer Text: Read about the candidates and see who sounds least crazy to you.

Excuse text: I need a ride
Answer Text: There are lots of organizations that can help you get to the polls on election day.

Excuse text: My candidate won't win anyway
Answer Text: No one wins if you don't show up.

Image description/alt text: Pulp Fiction Jules is sick of your not voting excuses
Excuse text: Both parties are the same
Answer Text: No. They aren't. For real, stop saying that. Learn the difference.

Image description/alt text: It is alright alright alright to vote
Excuse text: I only vote in Presidential Elections
Answer Text: The President is not the only thing on the ballot. Your Congressional reps, Senators, Governor, and local officials shape more actual policy that affects your everyday life.

Excuse text: I might vote if I am not busy that day
Answer Text: Look into potential early voting times, which can stretch your available voting period out to weeks.

Excuse text: One vote doesn't matter
Answer Text:
Your vote + those you help vote = democracy in action! 
Start your own registration drive!

Excuse text: It will take too long
Answer Text: Make some friends in line.

Excuse text: I am here but they won't let me vote
Answer Text: Always ask for a provisional ballot if you are not found on the voter rolls

Image description/alt text: the rock drives to the polls
Excuse text: I don't have an ID
Answer Text: Vote Riders will help you get an ID for your State.

Excuse text: Other people know more about it than I do
Answer Text: You are the only one that can represent your interests. Not this guy.

Image description/alt text: Voting is the least you can do for your country
Excuse text: It's too much effort
Answer Text: How much is democracy worth to you?

Excuse text: They won't count my vote anyway
Answer Text:
If you have any problems at the polls call 
(866) OUR-VOTE

Excuse text: Voting supports the corrupt two-party system.
Answer Text: What do you change by not voting?

Excuse text: I don't have time
Answer Text:
Many states offer Early Voting before Election Day. 
Find out your polling times and plan ahead!

Excuse text: Voting is a conspiracy
Answer Text: Voting is a conspiracy where the people that show up get more of what they want than the people who don't.

Excuse text: I just never get around to it
Answer Text: There's no time like today to change that.

Image description/alt text: Picard tells you to engage with your ballot
Excuse text: I don't like either candidate
Answer Text: What do you mean “either candidate”? Read your whole ballot - there are often other options.

Image description/alt text: Get your ass up soldier and vote
Excuse text: My candidate didn't win last time
Answer Text: You lose some elections and you win some. Stop feeling sorry for yourself and get in there and fight!

Excuse text: I voted 2 years ago, why do I have to vote again?
Answer Text: Voting works when you show up every time. If you can be counted on to vote in every election, candidates care more about your issues. Show up for primaries, run-offs, local elections...every damn time.

Excuse text: I am too tired
Answer Text: Not voting is surrender! Don't give up!

Image description/alt text: It's never too late to learn voting
Excuse text: I don't know enough about how government works
Answer Text:
There are resources, videos, crash courses...all available if you click on some links. 
There is no shame in starting now.

Image description/alt text: I want you to take responsibility for a functioning government
Excuse text: The government is too broken to fix
Answer Text:
The government isn't going to fix itself. 
Don't get defeated. Get involved.

Excuse text: Everybody is so negative
Answer Text: Negative ads are designed to get angry and scared people to the polls while discouraging other voters. Channel your frustration into action!

Excuse text: I'm on a boat
Answer Text: Got your swim trunks, and your flippie-floppies and your ballot?

Image description/alt text: Big Lebowski Walter wants to remind you to vote
Excuse text: I forgot
Answer Text: Sign up for election reminders!

Excuse text: I'm going to sit this one out
Answer Text: Vote every damn time!

Excuse text: Everything is controlled by corporations
Answer Text: Vote for candidates that are fighting for campaign finance reform. Support the DISCLOSE Act.

Image description/alt text: I cannot believe I still have to protest this shit
Excuse text: Things take too long to change
Answer Text: Representative democracy isn't designed to get everyone everything they want immediately. It is a constant negotiation of rights.

Excuse text: I would rather argue on the internet
Answer Text: Tell me how that works out for you.

Image description/alt text: What if I told you who is on the ballot
Excuse text: Nothing important is on the ballot
Answer Text: Every 2 years we have a chance to replace many of our Federal and State Representatives. And local elections determine what your city and neighborhood look like. Read your ballot.

Image description/alt text: Office Space Boss wants you to vote
Excuse text: I have to work
Answer Text: Your employer may be required to allow time off to vote.

Image description/alt text: The one thing they are all afraid of losing is the next election
Excuse text: No one is holding the politicians accountable
Answer Text: That's YOUR job.

Image description/alt text: Grandma at the computer can vote by mail
Excuse text: I am too old for this shit
Answer Text: Many seniors are eligible for absentee ballots.

Image description/alt text: Taco Bell vote is a shame to all tacos lovers
Excuse text: I don't know enough about it
Answer Text: Click on these links. Read some stuff. Talk to people.

Image description/alt text: Skeptical child questions your voting excuses
Excuse text: Nothing changes when I vote
Answer Text: Important policies can change with each administration at all levels of government.

Excuse text: Last time I went I couldn't vote
Answer Text: States are making more restrictive laws about what is required to vote. Make sure you have checked all your requirements like voter ID and voting location.

Image description/alt text: It is easy being a Kermit that votes
Excuse text: I will be on vacation
Answer Text: You can vote by absentee ballot if you will not be home to vote.

Image description/alt text: This is what disenfranchisement looks like
Excuse text: I am disenfranchised by gerrymandering
Answer Text: Statewide elections are not affected by gerrymandering. Every vote in your state counts for your Governors, Senators, and other statewide officials. Many of them are elected in Midterms.

Excuse text: My voice isn't heard
Answer Text: Which group got more of what they wanted? The ones who showed up to vote in the 2010 midterms.

Excuse text: It's hard to get an absentee ballot
Answer Text: This woman was born before women got the right to vote.

Excuse text: I'm a Nihilist
Answer Text: I'm sure doing nothing will fix everything.

Image description/alt text: Arnold Swartzenegger wants you to vote
Excuse text: I always wait till the last minute and miss it
Answer Text: Make a plan and vote early!

Excuse text: I don't want to have jury duty
Answer Text:
Jurors are no longer pulled from registered voters. 
Juries are part of democracy so suck it up.

Image description/alt text: Feels as bad as he looks still voted
Excuse text: I am sick or disabled
Answer Text: You can vote by absentee ballot.

Excuse text: I will be overseas
Answer Text: Use an absentee ballot.

Excuse text: I don't want anyone to know where I live
Answer Text: In certain circumstances, you can register to vote in Address Confidentiality Programs.

Image description/alt text: Penguins in Antarctica are welcoming you to not vote
Excuse text: I don't want to participate in a system that was forced on me
Answer Text: Man, being born in America sure is a burden. Maybe try somewhere with fewer civic responsibilities? Participate to change a system you disagree with.

Excuse text: I have a prison record
Answer Text: Many states reinstate your right to vote after your time has been served.

Excuse text: I hate standing in line
Answer Text: Look into early voting, and see if you can hit your polling location in the off-hours.

Excuse text: I don't know how to register
Answer Text: Find a voter registrar to help you. Believe me, they are everywhere.

Excuse text: I don't like filling out forms
Answer Text: Come on It won't take that long.

Excuse text: I don't want to vote for the lesser evil
Answer Text: Can you live with “more evil” winning because you did nothing?

Image description/alt text: I will find you and I will register you to vote
Excuse text: I am not registered yet
Answer Text: States have different registration deadlines. Be sure to know yours.

Excuse text: Everything seems out of control
Answer Text: Vote out people that undermine our norms that have kept America functional for centuries.

Image description/alt text: Colin Kapernick wants you to vote
Excuse text: Politics are too divisive
Answer Text: Listen to and try to find common ground - important things are often difficult.

Excuse text: My husband's vote will just cancel mine out
Answer Text: Does that stop him from voting? Vote anyway and welcome to the 21st century - League of Women Voters Guide

Excuse text: Lots of other people don't vote
Answer Text: Yes, and that's a HUGE problem! Don't be part of the problem. Be part of the solution!

Excuse text: I will only vote for someone who agrees with me about every issue.
Answer Text: If you want someone who agrees with you on every possible issue, YOU should run for office.

Image description/alt text: Chill the fuck out and vote
Excuse text: I am too stressed out to deal with politics
Answer Text: I feel ya. Take some deep breaths. You can do it.
column10: do I want to do any specific democratic ones?

Image description/alt text: What if I told you you can still vote
Excuse text: I don't have an address
Answer Text: Persons experiencing homelessness can still vote in all 50 states.
column10: how many waht if I told you?

Excuse text: I am active duty military overseas
Answer Text: Use an absentee ballot. And thank you for protecting my freedom and both our rights to vote.

Image description/alt text: if voting doesn't matter why to they try to keep us from voting?
Excuse text: Voting doesn't matter
Answer Text: It matters enough to those in power that they make voter suppression laws

Excuse text: I am in jail
Answer Text: You can vote by absentee ballot.

Excuse text: If I don't vote than I am not responsible for who wins
Answer Text:
Everyone is responsible for who wins. 
Not voting just lets other people decide instead of you.

Excuse text: I just moved
Answer Text: Change your address or vote by absentee ballot.

Excuse text: It's too hard to register
Answer Text: Some states do make it hard. But you do things every day that are hard.

Excuse text: There are other things on the ballot I don't know anything about
Answer Text: Local & State elections impact you more than National elections. And your vote counts more locally! Look up endorsements in your local newspaper or local news blog sites.

Excuse text: I don't care who wins
Answer Text: Really???
